constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: NEIPOL Name: SB1  South of the Borough
NEIGH Name: South of the Borough
SAC SAC Type: SPECIAL CONTROL OF ADVERTS
AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

description: Change of use from Use Classes B2 (General Industry) / B8 (Storage and Distribution) to Mixed Industrial Uses  B1(b) (Research and Development) /B1(c) (Light Industrial use) / B2 (General Industry)/B8 (Storage and Distribution)
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason:  As required  by Section 91 of  the Town  and Country Planning  Act  1990,  as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

A Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved. The details submitted shall be designed to manage the transport needs of the employees, in order to demonstrate a car restraint policy for the site, minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport. This must include details on the number of employers at site. The approved scheme shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of the development and shall be retained for the life of the development.Reason: To ensure that sustainable transport methods are encouraged and implemented in accordance with Policies CS5 (Reducing the Need to Travel) and CS6 (Sustainable Travel) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, the cycle parking facilities as shown on the approved drawings shall be made available for use and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times. Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory cycle storage facilities and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with Policy DM8 (Sustainable Transport for New Developments) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development hereby approved shall be used for purposes falling within B1(b) (research and development)/B1(c) (light industrial use)/B2 (general industry) and B8 (storage and distribution) Use Classes only, and for no any other purpose as defined in the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instruction revoking and re-enacting that Order (with or without modification), without written consent from the Local Planning Authority first being obtained. Reason: To enable the Local Planning Authority to exercise control of the type of use within the category in order to safeguard the amenities of the area in accordance with Policies DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions)  and DM17 (Protecting Existing Employment Land and Premises) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Should the access into the site during construction not be paved, spoil could be carried from the site onto the public highway. The access into the site should be paved to minimise the carryover of spoil onto adjacent roads.We would also require the applicant to sweep and wash down the adjacent roads to ensure that the public highway is kept clear of debris. This is to ensure a satisfactory road surface for road safety reasons at all times.

It is highlighted that any proposed works will result in substantial movement of heavy vehicles on the highways, and therefore the Council will require the applicant to undertake a road and footway condition survey before construction begins. This will take the form of a joint inspection with a member of the Street Scene Team and will involve a photographic record and visual observation of the roads, verges and margins.

We have a digital system to measure the scale bar, the submitted existing and proposed floor plans, roof plan, existing elevations do not measure to stated scale. Please revise the documents with the correct scale bar.
The application fee and description will be finalised after receiving final drawings.
Please revise all supporting documents if required to reflect the revised descritpion.
Inconsistent Floor Plans - please amend the Proposed First and Second Floor plans to correctly show the Proposed Ground Floor plan.
